item.title: 5 Minute Tutorials: Tricks with Purrr::map() #1
item.description: Quick Overview Hi hi! This is intended to be a very quick tutorial highlighting bite-sizeable and really helpful R tips. What are we looking at today I wanted to share how to use purrr::map() to apply function that produces more that one output (columns) to a dataframe. How We ware going to make basic script that lists all files in a directory and its sub-directories that have a specific extension.
